comments.commentBody: You are very misinformed.  The Baltimore police force is well over 40 % black; its transit and school force are very predominantly black.  The city sheriff's office and department of corrections ditto.  There are definitely racial aspects to police miscondUCT but there are brutal cops of any background. Baltimore does not want for minority officers.  It does suffer, as do many departments, from the solid blue line.

Watching the TV news coverage of what's going in Baltimore, begs the question for me . . . . Is there a single non-white cop anywhere in Maryland to be found?

Judging from the hints of faces behind the face masks or their arms, it appears there's some pretty racially disproportionate police representation - which only exemplifies and attests to the grievances of those speaking out.

Oh, I could say more.  It seems like the bank runs / bank boycotts only happen during some of these financial crises.  If you don't solve the underlying problem, though, the crises just keep recurring until you do get to one with irremediable bank runs.
Finally no longer helpless and passive. It's the only way to bring change. Look where  Occupy Wall Street got you,
Make the same mistake three times, and a choice has been made.  America is on fire again and it is about 'Us'.

It could also be a harakiri sword used at the wrong time or worse, with the wrong enemy. You would not think of using non-violence when confronting the nazy armies, would you? Well, the thugs in the US police forces are very close to Gestapo officers. They do not buckle under the weight of moderation or restrain.
We are now a police state. They are the enemy.
And the coverup!!
Say what ???
You might also think that when mayhem and anarchy truly begins, they are completely ineffectual. And when things are peaceful, many of the worst violent situations are initiated by them.

For those of you using Martin Luther King Jr. to criticize the rioting in Baltimore, don't forget he also said it would be “morally irresponsible” to condemn rioting “without, at the same time, condemning the contingent, intolerable conditions that exist in our society." This kind of violent protest does not occur without instigation. Our country is desperate for extreme police reform and people are no longer going to watch silently as an oppressive institution abuses it's citizens. Whether you believe the violence in Baltimore is justified or not, please do not let it be in vain. Stop arguing about the protest itself and start talking about how to fix the system that incurred it.

Some of us feel we are living already in a Third World Country due to the diversity of the economy, the crumbling infrastructure, our inability to communicate among our rich variety of cultures, and there is nothing so ugly as the 'involuntary poverty' that one sees in our Nation today and our dwindling educational skills.

No time to waste; time to unite as one people. There are good people among us to help bring us together in a concerted hard effort to get our Country to move forth, a long road ahead, but Americans have the will-power to do this if they hear and care.
You are in denial.

Leigh, I work with the same kids, seen the deaths and the poverty -- but from all ethnicities.   That whole thing, that "most of them are good kids" -- it makes excuses for destructive behaviors and doesn't really help them. In my experience, it lands them in prison.
Yet, Dr. King's dream remains only a dream.

And they are cheering that black mother beating her son for fear that he might end up like Freddie Gray. Gray was profiled, stalked, stopped and beaten for making eye contact with the cops while black.  We used to call it reckless eye-balling.  Where were the mother's of the cops who beat Eric Garner, Freddie Gray, Amadou Diallo etc.? How about the mothers of the cops who shot Michael Brown, John Crawford, Akai Gurley, Tamir Rice, Oscar Grant, Walter Scott, and Eric Harris?

He was arrested, he entered the car; he was walking, talking, standing; he had a functioning back. The police deliver him up: his back is broken, and his spine almost entirely severed. Did he do it to himself, while handcuffed? Did aliens invade the police car while in transit? You tell me.

Jews, Hispanics, Muslims....won't come together and you know why...because they are afraid for their lives. Every time these "peaceful" protests turn violent the African Community from which in came from looses all credibility.
The News media exacerbates the issue in it's 24 news cycle and all your left with is more broken lives and business's.

What's going on right now in the US is bigger than we think. Wake up you guys. When people say "Be awake" it is a serious thing!
Now being a black woman who knows her history about literally everything involving my culture and the government these things are not uncommon. This society wasn't made for us to live equally. Sad, but true.
These protests are for being tired and over america in general. These killings are unfortunately going to continue to happen.
On the African american part we all need to educated our youth. The mind can do beautiful things if only they knew! were taught! encouraged to do better! Protests are good too, but the knowledge and the skill is what puts them on top, read about your politics, & pray.
The others who are not African American who see what's going on and actually care (I hope you do) should publicly walk along my community and reach out to people you know to let them know the history, the struggle, the need for understanding where we come from and just for wanting a place of peace in general. Study the African American history like you would any other culture.
I was doing research on the Jews, Hispanics, Muslims, and wow if only everyone just came together! All of us have suffered the corruption and racism in this world. We should not point fingers for like I said this is nothing new, but we should come together (yes I said it), educate, and keep pushing forward.
Pray for Baltimore. Pray for us all.

What would you suggest? Let them burn down the entire city as the way to pacify them? The people causing damage are not legitimate protestors, they are criminals, and they need to be dealt with as criminals.

Baltimore has been on the front row of cities full of people receiving financial help throughout the $22 Trillion of money pouring out of Washington, D.C. for food, medical care, housing, etcertera for fifty YEARS. If Baltimore is still a desperate, awful place, it is NOT because anybody cheated the city on funding categories.
Perhaps you should look at how much is spent per student in Baltimre, BEFORE you rant - it's the highest in MD, and one of the highest in the nation

Community leaders may be calling for jobs, better school and hope for some semblance of a future, but there will be no new jobs programs and no movement for better schools in Baltimore or any other of our cities. Congress could care less about Baltimore. We are operating under neo-liberal economic policies driven hard by the GOP and only slightly less hard by the Dems.

Under this ideological frame in order for anything to have value it must be turned into a commodity, including our schools, prisons and jails, hospitals, everything and what commodity value do these young black men have?

Their value as consumers is reduced to what is sold at a 99 Cent store. Their value as a student is simply a statistic to funnel public money into private hands for a lousy product. If they make it out of high school and seek to go to college their value isn't as a future community leader. It's as borrower and holder of exorbitant student loans. Their value in the housing market is to disappear from emerging gentrified areas so "development" can take place.

But what about their value as human beings? Neo-liberals don't count that as a commodity. A human being is hard to monitize, trade on the stock market or turn into a derivative. So don't expect anything from Congress or for that matter from the president. These communities are on their own and these young men have been abandoned. Black lives in America don't matter.

This is a wonderful recipe that I have made many times and often freeze to have something sweet on hand.  I mostly skip the cinnamon because cinnamon is overused as a flavoring.  I have also made this with pluots (plum/apricots, with sliced peaches and with cherries.  All good.  The real beauty is how fast this quick dessert comes together with ingredients you have on hand plus fresh fruit.
So after a night of rioting, looting, arson and anarchy what is your solution? Should the police and national guard stay in their barracks? I suspect that most residents of Baltimore would not agree.
I'm not white. You assumed it.  I'm brown; an immigrant.

I do not agree with your point.

Riot, looting and vandalism are consequences - It's the same coin face: explosion of something uncontrollable. You can not judge everything that is happening rationally or find that revolting should behave this or that way.

When you oppress a person for a long time, that person, at some point in life, may have a tantrum that can kill you. That goes for anything: people, ideas, behaviors, etc. When you oppress, you are creating an opposite reaction force that at some point explode.

In the 80s, Lee said the following about the Hip Hop because he had an angry tone: "how do you want these young people don't have a angry tone after years of repression?"

I understand your point, but it is superficial. It's like wanting to understand Paris through photos and videos. You can not understand Paris until is there and feel with your sensory system.

You can not look at this issue by rational bias. If you do not know what it means anger and how it takes a human being, then you can not point the finger.

"They want black folks to 'march peacefully,' which will accomplish nothing. and just be content with their impoverished existence."

If you want something other than an impoverished existence in this country, you have to work for it. That means getting an education, staying out of trouble and assimilating into the ways of society. You are not entitled to demand a better life, and nobody is ever going to hand it to you. If you decide to riot rather than peacefully demonstrate, then all you deserve is jail.

Wake up and do something productive for yourself and the society you inhabit. There is not now and will never be any other way.
If you "don't hear the black community" on issues like this one, maybe you aren't listening very well.
